gurmukhi: dyS ibdyS nrySn jIq AnyS bfy AvnyS sMGwry ] AwToeI is`D sBY nviniD smiR`Dn srb Bry giH swry ]
transliteration: Desh Bidesh Dareshan Jeet Anesh Bade Avnesh Sanhdare|| Aathoisiddh Sabhai Navnidh(i) Samriddhan Sarab Bhare Grah(i) Sdare||
translation: This KAL (death) has killed the great sovereigns of all the countries and the earth, who had eight powers, nine treasures, all kinds of accomplishments;

gurmukhi: cMdRmuKI binqw bhuqY Gir mwl Bry nhI jwq sMBwry ] nwm ibhIn ADIn Bey jm AMiq ko nwgy hI pwie isDwry ]491]
transliteration: Channdramoukhi Banitaa Bahoutai Ghar(i) Maal Bhare Nahijaat Sanbhare|| Naam Biheen Adheen Bhae Jam Ant(i) Ko Naage Hipaae Sidhdare||491||
translation: Moon-faced women and unlimited wealth; they all left this world with naked feet under the control of Yama, without the remembrance of the Name of the Lord.491.

gurmukhi: rwvn ky mihrwvn ky mn ky nl ky clqy n clI gau ] Boj idlIpq kO riv kY nhI swQ dXo rGunwQ blI kau ]
transliteration: Raavan Ke Maihraavan Ke Man Ken Al Ke Chalte Na Chaligaddd| Bhoj Dileepat Kau Rab(i) Kai Nahisaath Dayo Raghounaath Balikau||
translation: Even Ravan and Mehravan were helpless before him; he did not even co-operate with king Bhoj, the Delhi kings of Surya clan, the mighty Raghunath etc.;

gurmukhi: sMig clI Ab lO nhI kwhU ky swc khO AG AauG dlI sau ] cyq ry cyq Acyq mhw Dsu kwhU ky sMig clI n hlI hau ]492]
transliteration: San(i) Chaliab Lau Nahikaahoo Ke Saach Kahau Agh Aough Dalisau|| Chet Re Chet Achet Mahaa Pas(u) Kaahoo Ke San(i) Chalina Halihau||492||
translation: He did not even side with the destroyer of the store of sins; therefore O great animal-like unconscious mind! come into your senses, but consider that the KAL (death) did not consider anyone its own.492.

gurmukhi: swc AO JUT khy bhuqY ibD kwm kroD Anyk kmwey ] Bwj nlwj bcw Dn ky fr lok gXo prlok gvwey ]
transliteration: Saach Au Jhooth Kahe Bagoutai Bidh Kaam Darodh Anek Kamaae|| Bhaaj Nalaaj Bachaa Dhan Ke Dar Lok Gyo Parlok Gadaae||
translation: The being, in many ways, speaking both truth and falsehood, absorbed himself in lust and anger; for earning and gathering wealth unashamedly lost both theis and the next world;

gurmukhi: duAwds brK pVw n guiVE jV rwjIv locn nwihn pwey ] lwj ibhIn ADIn ghy jm AMq kO nwgy hI pwie isDwey ]493]
transliteration: Duaadas Barakh Padaa Na Gudio Jad Raajeev Lochanndnaahin Paae|| Laaj Biheen Adheen Gade Jam Ant Kau Naage Hipaae Sidhaae||493||
translation: Though he obtained education for twelve-years, but did not follow its sayings and lotus-eyed (Rajiv-lochan) could not realise that Lord; the unashamed being will ultimately be caught by Yama and it will have to go with naked feet from this place.493.

gurmukhi: kwhy kau bsqR Dro Bgvy mun qy sB pwvk bIc jlYgI ] kXoN ] iem rIq clwvq ho idn dÍYk clY sRbdw n clYgI ]
transliteration: Kaahe Kau Bastra Sdaro Bhagve Mounndte Sabh Paavak Beech Jalaigee|| Kyon Im Reet Chadaavat Ho Din Dvaik Chalai Srabdaa Na Chalaigee||
translation: O sages ! why do you wear ochre-coloured clothes?, they will all be burnt in the fire at the end. Why do you introduce such-like rites, which will not continue for ever?

gurmukhi: kwl krwl kI rIq mhwN ieh kwhU jugys ClI n ClYgI ] suMdir dyih qumwrI mhwmuin AMiq mswn hÍY DUr rlYgI ]494]
transliteration: Kaal Karaal Kireet Mahaan Eh Kaahoo Jouges Chhalina Chhalaigee|| Soundar(i) Deh(i) Toumaarimahaamounndi) Ant(i) Masaan Hvai Dhoor Ralaigee||494||
translation: Now one will be able to deceive the great tradition of the dreadful KAL; O sage ! your beautiful body will ultimately be mixed with dust.494.

gurmukhi: kwhy kO paun BCo suin ho muin paun BCy kCu hwQ n AYhY ] kwhy ko bsqR kro Bgvw ien bwqn so Bgvwn n hÍY hY ]
transliteration: Kaahe Kaoupaoun Bhachhodhsoun(i) Ho Mounndi) Paoun Bhachhe Kachh(u) Haath Na Aihai|| Kaahe Ko Bastra Daro Bhagvaa In Baatan So Bhagvaan Na Hvai Hai||
translation: O sage ! why are you only subsisting on wind ? You will not achieve anything by doing this; you cannot even attain that supreme Lord by wearing the ochre-coloured clothes;

gurmukhi: byd purwn pRmwn kY dyKhu qy sB hI bs kwl sBY hY ] jwr AnMgn nMg khwvq sIs kI sMig jtwaU n jY hY ]495]
transliteration: Bed Puraan Pramaan Kai Dekhoh Te Sabh Hibas Kaal Sabhai Hai|| Jaar Ananad Nan Kahaavat Sees Kisan(i) Jataaoo Na Jai Hai||495||
translation: Look at the illustrations of all the Vedas, Pranas etc., then you will know that all are under the control of KAL; you can be called ANANG (limbless) by burning your lust, but even your matted locks will not accompany your head and all this will be destro

gurmukhi: kMcn kot igrXo khu kwhy n swqE swgr kXoN n sukwno ] pScm Bwn audXo khu kwhy n gMg bhI aultI Anmwno ]
transliteration: Kanchanndkot Giryo Kahu Kaahe Na Saato Saagad Syon Na Soukaano|| Pashcham Bhaan Udyo Kahu Kaahe Na Gadg Bahiultianmaano||
translation: Undoubtedly, the citadels of gold be reduced to dust, all the seven oceans be dried up, the sun may rise in the west, the Ganges may flow in the opposite direction,

gurmukhi: AMiq bsMq qpXo riv kwhy n cMd smwn idnIs pRmwno ] kXoN fumfol fubIn Drw muinrwj inpwqin qXoN jg jwno ]496]
transliteration: Ant(i) Basant Tapyo Rav(i) Kaahe Na Channd Samaan Dinees Pramaano|| Kyon Doumdol Doubeen Dharaa Mounndraaj Nipaatan(i) Tyon Jag Jaano||496||
translation: The sun may heat in the spring season, the sun may become cold like the moon, the earth supported by the tortoise may shake, but even then, O king of the sages ! the destruction of the world is certain by KAL.496.

gurmukhi: AqR prwsr nwrd swrd bXws qy Awid ijqy mun Bwey ] gwlB Awid AnMq munISÍr bHm hUM qy nhI jwq gnwey ]
transliteration: Atra Paraasar Naarad Saarad Byaas Te Aadh Jite Mounndbhaae|| Gadlabh Aadh Anant Mounndeshvar Brahm Hoon Te Nahijaat Gadaae||
translation: There have been many sages like Atri, Parashar, Narada, Sharda, Vyas etc., who cannot be counted even by Brahma;
